item.title: America by Allen Ginsberg
item.description: [[beat generation]] [[red scare]] [[McCarthyism]] America is personified [!Poem] America America I’ve given you all and now I’m nothing. 1 America two dollars and twentyseven cents January 17, 1956.

item.title: Imagine by John Lennon
item.description: no countries, no religion, no possessions, no division no hunger read also: [[Anarchy]]

item.title: Partition by W.H Auden
item.description: by W.H. Auden About the Author Summary and themes about the India - Pakistan partition in 1947 angry about partition, directed towards Radcliffe

item.title: Sailing to Byzantium by WB Yeats
item.description: by ![[W.B Yeats]] written in 1926 Yeats was in his 60s “the state of my soul and some of my thoughts about the subject” time of industrial revolution

item.title: The Prelude
item.description: [!NOTE]- Poem The winter evening settes down With smell of steaks in passagewats Six o’clock The burnt-out ends of smoky days.
